meanings.definition: Cooked in a pot over heat.
meanings.sent1: She potboiled the soup for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The chef potboiled the pasta until it was al dente.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they potboiled their marshmallows over the campfire.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the potboiled stew filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the potboiled water bubbling was soothing.

meanings.definition: Made or produced quickly and without much thought.
meanings.sent2: He wrote a potboiled novel in just a week.
meanings.sent3: The potboiled artwork was hastily done.
meanings.sent4: The potboiled speech failed to inspire the audience.
meanings.sent5: Her potboiled decision led to regret.

meanings.sent1: She potboiled the eggs for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: The chef potboiled the vegetables for the soup.
meanings.sent3: The cat curiously watched as the water potboiled on the stove.
meanings.sent4: The potboiled water splashed as it bubbled.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the potboiled broth filled the room.
